connector.description:
Send data to Kafka topics through SCRAM login module.

The Kamelet is able to understand the following headers to be set:

- `key` / `ce-key`: as message key

- `partition-key` / `ce-partitionkey`: as message partition key

Both the headers are optional.

camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.topic.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.topic
camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.topic.description: Comma separated list of Kafka topic names

camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.bootstrap.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.bootstrapServers
camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.bootstrap.description: Comma separated list of Kafka Broker URLs

camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.securityP.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.securityProtocol
camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.securityP.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. SASL_PLAINTEXT, PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL and SSL are supported

camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.saslMecha.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.saslMechanism
camel.kamelet.kafka-scram-sink.saslMecha.description: The Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Mechanism used.
